void printToFileArray2D (array2D A, int m1, int m2, FILE *file)

Detailed Description

Routines for allocating and deallocation multi dimensional arrays.

Allows for random access of multidimensional array that are stored linear. Example: Let A a m-by-n array that is stored column-wise. Then the element A(i,j) is accessed by A[i+m*j]. For faster access to avoid index computations the methods below create indices, such that

A(i,j) = A[i+m*j] = A[j][i].

It is important that in the dimensions of an Array array must be passed in reverse order to the allocation methods!

Author:
Stefan Heldmann
Date:
19/04/2005

Create a 2d array. For an m-by-n array call createArray2D(n,m) such that.

Note:
A(i,j) = A[i+m*j] = A[j][i]

size_t  m2,
size_t  m3
) 
 

Create a 3d array. For an m-by-n-by-p array call createArray3D(p,n,m) such that.

Note:
A(i,j,k) = A[i+m*(j+n*k] = A[k][j][i]

array4D createArray4D (  size_t  m1,
size_t  m2,
size_t  m3,
size_t  m4
) 
 

Create an 4d array. For an m-by-n-by-p-by-q array call createArray4D(q,p,n,m) such that.

Note:
A(i,j,k,l) = A[i+m*(j+n*(k+p*l)] = A[l][k][j][i]
